result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 3:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent to each other with credit of 71 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge as to each count, during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Court does not object to probation transfer to Kenosha. 
Appeal rights given. 

Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the defense, Court ordered $50.00 Cash Bond set with all condition of companion case to remain the same, with Turn over to JusticePoint for continued monitoring.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 46. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record - court is in trial

Defense request for a status date is approved.  Case is adjourned for status in Branch 46  Status conference scheduled for 03-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart Store - Capitol Drive

Defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Gerald Jeffrey Ray in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
